model

Enum Link

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Link>
      • model.Link
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<Link>

     enum Link
extends Enum<Link>
    A Link describes the way 3 Cubes follow each other.

    When comparing the Cubes list and the LinksList, a Link has the same index as the central Cube of the 3 that it describes. This central Cube is referred to as the "associated" Cube.

    This enum's values mean:

    • END: the associated cube is an end cube.
    • STRAIGHT: the associated cube is in the middle of 3 cubes following each other in a straight line. This can be represented as:
       OOO
    • ELBOW: the associated cube is in the middle of an elbow, which means that the 3 cubes form a 90-degrees angle. This can be represented as:
       OO
 O

    Author:
    Joffrey Bion

      • getNextPossibleCubes

        abstract LinkedList<Cube> getNextPossibleCubes(Cube previous,
                                    Cube current)
        Returns a list of the possible cubes that can follow the 2 specified cubes with this Link.
        Parameters:
        previous - The position of the previous Cube, which is the first among the 3 considered cubes.
        current - The position of the associated Cube, which is the second among the 3 considered cubes.
        Returns:
        A list of the possible cubes for the 3rd position of this Link .
